'''Furfrou''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''トリミアン''' ''Trimmien'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It is not known to [[Evolution|evolve]] into or from any other Pokémon.

Furfrou can have its hair trimmed into nine [[List of Pokémon with form differences#Furfrou|different styles]] to change its appearance. The styles include the '''Star''', '''Diamond''', '''Heart''', '''Pharaoh''', '''Kabuki''', '''La Reine''', '''Matron''', '''Dandy''', and '''Debutante''' Trim. A trimmed Furfrou will revert into its Natural Form if five days have passed since it was trimmed without being deposited in the [[PC]], or if it is deposited in ([[Generation VI]]) or withdrawn from ([[Generation VII]]) the PC.

==Biology==
Furfrou is a dog-like Pokémon with thick, white fur that covers its black body apart from its paws and face. It has round eyes with blue eyelids and red irises, a pointed snout with a round nose at the end, and long rectangular ears. When its mouth is open, two pointed teeth can be seen on its upper jaw. 

This Pokémon's furry coat cushions it against physical attacks, though cutting it increases the swiftness of its movements. It used to guard the king in the ancient times of Kalos. Like some real-world poodles, some domesticated Furfrou are commonly seen with their fur trimmed into various styles. Furfrou is known to be loyal to its Trainer, and only allows someone it trusts to trim it. In the past, aristocrats would even compete over who could trim its fur into the most exquisite style.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Jessica Furfrou.png|250px|thumb|Furfrou Natural Form in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
Multiple Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY008|Grooming Furfrou!]]'', including one that belonged to {{OBP|Jessica|XY008}}.

A Matron Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY018|Awakening the Sleeping Giant!]]'', under the ownership of [[Princess Allie]].

A Dandy Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY047|Dreaming a Performer's Dream!]]'', under the ownership of [[Kayleigh]]. It competed with its Trainer in a Rookie Class Pokémon Showcase. However, their performance was interrupted by a {{TP|Serena|Pancham}} that appeared onstage and began imitating Furfrou's moves. After Pancham broke a stage lamp and fell on the stage, it ran off the stage in fear.

A Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY060|A Showcase Debut!]]'', under the ownership of [[Alouette]]. It was briefly stylized into a Pharaoh Trim. It appeared again in ''[[XY112|Master Class is in Session!]]'', where it was used in the Master Class Pokémon Showcase in [[Gloire City]].

A Matron Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]'', under the ownership of [[Delilah]]. It assisted the other judges in evaluating the baking during the Theme Performance of the [[Dendemille Town]] {{pkmn|Showcase}} Rookie Class.

A Kabuki Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]'', under the ownership of [[Everett]]. Everett used it in his battle against Ash, where it faced off against {{AP|Pikachu}} but was eventually defeated.

====Minor appearances====
Furfrou debuted in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]''.

Furfrou made cameo appearances in ''[[XY002|Lumiose City Pursuit!]]'', ''[[XY009|Clemont's Got a Secret!]]'', ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]'', ''[[XY027|To Find a Fairy Flower!]]'', ''[[XY029|Heroes - Friends and Faux Alike!]]'', and ''[[XY043|Origins of Mega Evolution!]]''.

Two Natural Form Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY016|A Jolting Switcheroo!]]''.

A Furfrou appeared in a fantasy in ''[[XY020|Breaking Titles at the Chateau!]]''.

A Furfrou appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

A Pharaoh Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY039|Summer of Discovery!]]'' on a [[Pokévision]] video icon.

Five Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY040|Day Three Blockbusters!]]'', where they were seen in their Dandy, Star, Heart, Debutante, and Pharaoh Trims.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY041|Foggy Pokémon Orienteering!]]'' and ''[[XY042|Battling Into the Hall of Fame!]]''. In the latter episode, it sported a Kabuki Trim in a picture.

A La Reine Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY064|Battling with Elegance and a Big Smile!]]''.

A Trainer's Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY066|Confronting the Darkness!]]''.

A Trainer's Natural Form Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]''.

A Trainer's Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY084|Adventures in Running Errands!]]''.

A Trainer's Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]''.

A Trainer's Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY112|Master Class is in Session!]]''.

A Trainer's Debutante Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]''.

A Trainer's Natural Form Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]''.

Three Trainers each owned a Furfrou, which appeared in ''[[XY138|The First Day of the Rest of Your Life!]]''. Two of them were Natural Form, while the third was a Diamond Trim.

A Trainer's Natural Form Furfrou appeared in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''.

A Trainer's Natural Form Furfrou appeared during a flashback in ''[[SS036|The Legend of X, Y, and Z!]]''.

===In Pokémon Generations===
Star, Heart, and Diamond Trim Furfrou appeared in ''[[PG17|The Investigation]]''. They were stolen by [[Emma|Essentia]]'s Poké Ball Jack, after their Trainer battled her.

==In the manga==
[[File:Shauna Furry Adventures.png|thumb|Furfrou Natural Form in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{adv|Shauna}} owns a Furfrou, nicknamed Furry, in ''[[PAXY01|An X-cuse to Come Out and Play]]'', she uses it in her studies to be a Furfrou stylist.

In ''[[PAXY05|Kangaskhan...Kangascan't]]'' an illusion of a Furfrou appeared under the ownership of Celosia disguised as a Furfrou stylist. Shauna encountered it in an alleyway, which she mistakenly believes to be her missing one. She quickly realizes it actually belongs to the [[Celosia|stylist]] who trims it into the Pharaoh, Debutante, Dandy and Matron Trims. It disappears after Shauna had been possessed by Celosia's {{p|Honedge}}.

In ''[[PAXY08|What Does Charmander Do When It Dozes?]]'', A Furfrou appeared being trimmed to have a Heart Trim by its Trainer at Friseur Furfrou.

A Furfrou appeared in ''[[PAXY28|Scizor Defends]]'' as a Pokémon in the [[Pokémon Village]].

In ''[[PAXY39|Epilogue]]'', a Trainer had her Furfrou trimmed into a Kabuki Trim by Shauna at Friseur Furfrou. A Diamond, Star, and Heart Trim Furfrou were also seen being styled there.

==Trivia==
* Furfrou was [[n:New Pokémon spotted in Pokémon Direct|unintentionally revealed in a Pokémon Direct on September 4, 2013]].
* Furfrou is the only Pokémon with a [[catch rate]] of 160.

===Origin===
Furfrou is based on a {{wp|poodle}}. Its untrimmed form seems to draw some inspiration from {{wp|Afghan Hound}}s.

====Name origin====
Furfrou is a combination of ''fur'' and ''frou-frou'' (fancy, overly elaborate).

Trimmien may be a combination of ''trimming'' and ''chien'' (French for dog). It could also be a play on the phrase ''très bien'' (French for excellent).
